title: N03-1026

sentences.text: We present an application of ambiguity packing and stochastic disambiguation techniques for Lexical-Functional Grammars -LRB- LFG -RRB- to the domain of sentence condensation .

Our system incorporates a linguistic parser/generator for LFG , a transfer component for parse reduction operating on packed parse forests , and a maximum-entropy model for stochastic output selection .
Furthermore , we propose the use of standard parser evaluation methods for automatically evaluating the summarization quality of sentence condensation systems .
An experimental evaluation of summarization quality shows a close correlation between the automatic parse-based evaluation and a manual evaluation of generated strings .
Overall summarization quality of the proposed system is state-of-the-art , with guaranteed grammaticality of the system output due to the use of a constraint-based parser/generator .

Entity-proposed_system.label: proposed system
Entity-proposed_system.description: The proposed system is a state-of-the-art sentence condensation software that utilizes ambiguity packing and stochastic disambiguation techniques within a Lexical-Functional Grammar framework, ensuring grammaticality in its output through a constraint-based parser/generator.

Entity-ambiguity_packing.label: ambiguity packing
Entity-ambiguity_packing.description: Ambiguity packing is a linguistic method used in conjunction with stochastic disambiguation techniques to enhance the processing of Lexical-Functional Grammars (LFG) for tasks such as sentence condensation.

Entity-ambiguity_packing_and_stochastic_.label: ambiguity packing and stochastic disambiguation techniques
aliases: ambiguity packing and stochastic disambiguation techniques
Entity-ambiguity_packing_and_stochastic_.description: Ambiguity packing and stochastic disambiguation techniques refer to methods used in the context of Lexical-Functional Grammars for enhancing sentence condensation by efficiently managing multiple interpretations of sentences and probabilistically selecting the most appropriate outputs.

mentions.local_name: ambiguity packing and stochastic disambiguation techniques

Entity-sentence_condensation_system.label: sentence condensation systems
Entity-sentence_condensation_system.description: Sentence condensation systems are advanced text processing tools that utilize linguistic parsing and stochastic disambiguation techniques to automatically summarize and condense sentences while ensuring grammaticality and high-quality output.

Entity-our_system.label: Our system
Entity-our_system.description: Our system refers to a sophisticated linguistic framework designed for sentence condensation, which integrates a parser/generator based on Lexical-Functional Grammar, a component for reducing parses from packed parse forests, and a maximum-entropy model for selecting stochastic outputs.

Entity-lfg.label: LFG
Entity-lfg.description: LFG refers to Lexical-Functional Grammar, a linguistic framework used for parsing and generating sentences, particularly in the context of ambiguity packing and stochastic disambiguation techniques.

Entity-stochastic_output_selection.label: stochastic output selection
Entity-stochastic_output_selection.description: Stochastic output selection refers to a maximum-entropy model used in the context of a linguistic parser/generator for Lexical-Functional Grammars, which probabilistically determines the most appropriate outputs during the process of sentence condensation.

Entity-stochastic_disambiguation.label: stochastic disambiguation
Entity-stochastic_disambiguation.description: Stochastic disambiguation refers to a method used in computational linguistics, specifically within Lexical-Functional Grammars, to resolve ambiguities in language processing by employing probabilistic models for selecting the most likely interpretations or outputs.

Entity-sentence_condensation.label: sentence condensation
Entity-sentence_condensation.description: Sentence condensation refers to a text summarization technique that reduces the length of sentences while preserving their essential meaning, often utilizing linguistic parsing and stochastic methods to enhance the quality of the generated summaries.

Entity-an_experimental_evaluation_of_sum.label: An experimental evaluation of summarization quality
aliases: An experimental evaluation of summarization quality
Entity-an_experimental_evaluation_of_sum.description: An experimental evaluation of summarization quality refers to a systematic assessment that compares automatic parse-based evaluation methods with manual evaluations to determine the effectiveness and accuracy of summarization produced by a sentence condensation system.

mentions.local_name: An experimental evaluation of summarization quality

Entity-automatic_parse-based_evaluation.label: automatic parse-based evaluation
Entity-automatic_parse-based_evaluation.description: Automatic parse-based evaluation refers to a method for assessing the quality of sentence condensation systems by using standard parser evaluation techniques to automatically compare the generated outputs against manual evaluations.

Entity-generated_string.label: generated strings
Entity-generated_string.description: The term 'generated strings' refers to the outputs produced by the sentence condensation system, which are evaluated for their summarization quality in relation to both automatic and manual assessments.

Entity-the_system_output.label: the system output
Entity-the_system_output.description: The system output refers to the generated strings produced by the proposed sentence condensation system, which are ensured to be grammatically correct through the use of a constraint-based parser/generator.

Entity-constraint-based_parsergenerator.label: constraint-based parser/generator
Entity-constraint-based_parsergenerator.description: A constraint-based parser/generator is a computational tool used in natural language processing that employs a set of linguistic constraints to analyze and produce grammatically correct sentences.

Entity-overall_summarization_quality.label: Overall summarization quality
Entity-overall_summarization_quality.description: Overall summarization quality refers to the effectiveness and grammatical correctness of the output generated by a sentence condensation system, evaluated through both automatic and manual methods, indicating its performance relative to state-of-the-art standards.

Entity-parse_reduction.label: parse reduction
Entity-parse_reduction.description: Parse reduction refers to a transfer component in a linguistic system that operates on packed parse forests to simplify or condense the structure of sentences generated by a Lexical-Functional Grammar.

Entity-manual_evaluation_of_generated_st.label: manual evaluation of generated strings
Entity-manual_evaluation_of_generated_st.description: The manual evaluation of generated strings refers to the process of human assessment of the quality and coherence of text outputs produced by a system, particularly in the context of summarization and sentence condensation, to ensure that the generated content meets linguistic and contextual standards.

Entity-transfer_component.label: transfer component
Entity-transfer_component.description: The transfer component refers to a software module within the system that performs parse reduction on packed parse forests in the context of sentence condensation using Lexical-Functional Grammars.

Entity-transfer_component_for_parse_redu.label: transfer component for parse reduction
Entity-transfer_component_for_parse_redu.description: The 'transfer component for parse reduction' refers to a module within a linguistic system that operates on packed parse forests to simplify and reduce the complexity of syntactic structures during the process of sentence condensation.

Entity-packed_parse_forest.label: packed parse forests
Entity-packed_parse_forest.description: Packed parse forests are a data structure used in computational linguistics to represent multiple parse trees for a given input in a compact form, allowing for efficient storage and processing of syntactic information.

Entity-parser_evaluation_method.label: parser evaluation methods
Entity-parser_evaluation_method.description: Parser evaluation methods are techniques used to assess the performance and accuracy of parsers in analyzing and interpreting the structure of sentences in natural language processing.

Entity-linguistic_parsergenerator.label: linguistic parser/generator
Entity-linguistic_parsergenerator.description: A linguistic parser/generator is a software tool designed to analyze and produce natural language structures, facilitating the understanding and generation of linguistic data.

Entity-guaranteed_grammaticality.label: guaranteed grammaticality
Entity-guaranteed_grammaticality.description: Guaranteed grammaticality refers to the assurance that the output generated by a linguistic system, specifically one utilizing a constraint-based parser/generator, adheres to the rules of grammar, ensuring that the sentences produced are grammatically correct.

Entity-lexical-functional_grammar.label: Lexical-Functional Grammars
Entity-lexical-functional_grammar.description: Lexical-Functional Grammars is a theoretical framework in linguistics that focuses on the relationship between the syntactic structure of sentences and their functional aspects, emphasizing the role of lexical items in grammar.

Entity-summarization_quality.label: summarization quality
Entity-summarization_quality.description: Summarization quality refers to the measure or evaluation of how effectively a summarization process captures the essential information and meaning of the original text.

Entity-grammaticality.label: grammaticality
Entity-grammaticality.description: Grammaticality refers to the conformity of a sentence or phrase to the rules and conventions of a given language, indicating whether it is structurally and syntactically correct.

Entity-grammaticality_of_the_system_outp.label: grammaticality of the system output
Entity-grammaticality_of_the_system_outp.description: the degree to which the output generated by a system adheres to the rules and conventions of a given language.

Entity-maximum-entropy_model.label: maximum-entropy model
Entity-maximum-entropy_model.description: A maximum-entropy model is a statistical model used in machine learning that predicts outcomes based on the principle of maximizing entropy, subject to given constraints, thereby representing the most uniform distribution of probabilities consistent with the known information.

Entity-experimental_evaluation.label: experimental evaluation
Entity-experimental_evaluation.description: Experimental evaluation refers to a systematic method of assessing the effectiveness or quality of a process, product, or system through controlled experiments and empirical data collection.

Entity-manual_evaluation.label: manual evaluation
Entity-manual_evaluation.description: manual evaluation refers to the process of assessing or judging the quality or performance of a task or output through human judgment rather than automated methods.

Entity-system_output.label: system output
Entity-system_output.description: The term 'system output' refers to the results or data produced by a computational system or algorithm, typically as a response to input or processing tasks.

Entity-state-of-the-art.label: state-of-the-art
Entity-state-of-the-art.description: state-of-the-art refers to the highest level of development or performance in a particular field, often representing the most advanced techniques or technologies available.

summary: We present an application of ambiguity packing and stochastic disambiguation techniques for Lexical-Functional Grammars -LRB- LFG -RRB- to the domain of sentence condensation . Our system incorporates a linguistic parser/generator for LFG , a transfer component for parse reduction operating on packed parse forests , and a maximum-entropy model for stochastic output selection . Furthermore , we propose the use of standard parser evaluation methods for automatically evaluating the summarization quality of sentence condensation systems . An experimental evaluation of summarization quality shows a close correlation between the automatic parse-based evaluation and a manual evaluation of generated strings . Overall summarization quality of the proposed system is state-of-the-art , with guaranteed grammaticality of the system output due to the use of a constraint-based parser/generator .

Predicate-applied_to.label: applied to
Predicate-applied_to.description: The predicate 'applied to' indicates a relationship where the subject represents a method, technique, or process that is utilized or implemented in relation to the object, which typically denotes a specific task, problem, or domain. This connection implies that the subject is relevant and instrumental in achieving outcomes or addressing challenges associated with the object.

Predicate-for.label: for
Predicate-for.description: The predicate 'for' indicates a relationship of purpose, benefit, or relevance between the subject and the object. It suggests that the subject is intended to serve, support, or be applicable to the object in some way, often implying that the subject is designed or utilized with the object in mind.

Predicate-related_to.label: related to
Predicate-related_to.description: The predicate 'related to' establishes a connection or association between the subject and the object, indicating that they share a relevant link, context, or characteristic. This relationship can encompass various forms of connection, such as conceptual, functional, or categorical ties, suggesting that understanding one may provide insights into the other.

Predicate-incorporates.label: incorporates
Predicate-incorporates.description: The predicate 'incorporates' indicates that the subject includes or integrates the object as a part of its structure or functionality. It suggests a relationship where the subject actively combines or utilizes the object to enhance its capabilities or to fulfill a specific purpose.

Predicate-operates_on.label: operates on
Predicate-operates_on.description: The predicate 'operates on' indicates a functional relationship where the subject performs actions, processes, or manipulations that directly affect or utilize the object. It suggests that the subject is actively engaging with the object in a manner that alters, analyzes, or utilizes it for a specific purpose or outcome.

Predicate-is_for.label: is for
Predicate-is_for.description: The predicate 'is for' indicates a purpose, function, or intended use of the subject in relation to the object. It establishes a connection where the subject serves a specific role or is designed to achieve the outcomes represented by the object.

Predicate-propose_the_use_of.label: propose the use of
Predicate-propose_the_use_of.description: The predicate 'propose the use of' indicates a suggestion or recommendation made by the subject regarding the implementation or application of the object. It implies that the subject believes the object is beneficial or valuable in a certain context, and is advocating for its adoption or consideration.

Predicate-evaluate.label: evaluate
Predicate-evaluate.description: The predicate 'evaluate' signifies the action of assessing or determining the quality, effectiveness, or performance of the subject in relation to the object. In this context, it connects the subject, which represents a method or approach, to the object, which denotes a specific criterion or measure of success, thereby establishing a relationship where the subject is analyzed based on the standards or outcomes represented by the object.

Predicate-shows_a_close_correlation_betw.label: shows a close correlation between
Predicate-shows_a_close_correlation_betw.description: The predicate 'shows a close correlation between' indicates a significant relationship or connection between two entities, suggesting that changes or variations in one are closely associated with changes or variations in the other. This implies that the two subjects being compared exhibit a pattern of behavior or characteristics that are interrelated, often implying that understanding one can provide insights into the other.

Predicate-of.label: of
Predicate-of.description: The predicate 'of' indicates a relationship of belonging or association between the subject and the object, where the subject is characterized by or pertains to the object. It often signifies that the subject is a type, instance, or aspect related to the object, thereby establishing a connection that highlights the nature or context of the subject in relation to the object.

Predicate-is.label: is
Predicate-is.description: The predicate 'is' serves as a linking verb that establishes an identity or equivalence between the subject and the object. It indicates that the subject possesses the characteristics or qualities described by the object, effectively asserting that the subject can be defined or classified in terms of the object. This relationship can denote various states, conditions, or classifications, providing a foundational connection in the structure of the statement.

Predicate-has.label: has
Predicate-has.description: The predicate 'has' indicates a relationship of possession or ownership between the subject and the object. It signifies that the subject possesses, contains, or is characterized by the object, establishing a connection where the object represents a quality, feature, or attribute that is inherent to or associated with the subject.

Predicate-ensures.label: ensures
Predicate-ensures.description: The predicate 'ensures' indicates a relationship where the subject is responsible for guaranteeing or confirming the validity, correctness, or quality of the object. In this context, it implies that the subject takes measures or implements mechanisms that lead to the object being reliably achieved or maintained.

Predicate-uses.label: uses
Predicate-uses.description: The predicate 'uses' indicates that the subject employs or utilizes the object as a means to achieve a specific function or purpose. It establishes a relationship where the subject actively incorporates the object into its operations or processes, suggesting a dependency or reliance on the object for effectiveness or performance.

Predicate-utilizes.label: utilizes
Predicate-utilizes.description: The predicate 'utilizes' indicates that the subject employs or makes use of the object in a manner that enhances its functionality or effectiveness. It suggests an active engagement where the subject leverages the object as a resource, tool, or method to achieve a specific purpose or outcome.

Predicate-is_used_in_conjunction_with.label: is used in conjunction with
Predicate-is_used_in_conjunction_with.description: The predicate 'is used in conjunction with' indicates a relationship where the subject and object are employed together or in combination to achieve a specific purpose or outcome. This suggests that both elements complement each other and are often utilized simultaneously in a particular context or process.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, where the subject represents a specific concept or instance that falls under the more general category defined by the object. This relationship suggests that the object encompasses a wider scope or range of meanings, of which the subject is a part, thereby illustrating a classification or categorization in terms of linguistic or conceptual breadth.
